website_summaries.verdict: The Sony DRU-830A is a fast drive, but it's on the expensive side.
pros: interchangeable faceplates for different color systems
cons: A bit finicky with different brands of media

customer_reviews.title: Sony Band Burns
customer_reviews.text: This is a Great Unit for the Older PATA connection type computers. Sony has always been one of my choice brands over the years and the Parallel/PATA type have been excellent. Burns just about every brand CD and DVD on the market and although it will burn a coaster from time to time it usually only on the Cheaper brand CD's/DVD's on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Train

customer_reviews.title: Finally got it to burn properly
customer_reviews.text: I have tried a few different brands of media and all but 3 have been an unsuccessful burn. I use mainly Verbatim which IS compatible with this drive. After about 20 unsuccessful burns, the thing magically decided to burn media properly. I'm happy with it now, but my rating won't change for this because you shouldn't have to go through that many discs to "break in" a product. It costs an extra $8 for those wasted discs. Next time, it's Lite-On. Their products seem to work out of the box, not a "break in" product.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Grochowski

customer_reviews.title: painless installation; works as promised
customer_reviews.text: I mostly use my burner for backing up movie DVDs, and this dual-layer burner lets me back up from D9 to D9, without having to lose fidelity due to compression. The resulting DVDs are much clearer. For anyone who's ever changed out a computer disc drive, installing this internal drive will be routine. I had no problems whatsoever, and so far 100% of the discs I've burned have turned out perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: William J. Dyer

customer_reviews.title: Very wrong item
customer_reviews.text: I feel very disappointed, I was waiting for the SONY DVD REWRITABLE, and I just get a regular DVD ROM
customer_reviews.author: abel

customer_reviews.title: Great DVD/CD Burner
customer_reviews.text: This is a great optical drive. I just installed in a Dell and it works great. It came with a white face plate attached but it comes with a black face plate that is easy to change out. It runs fast and quiet. Comes with Nero software CD. Arrived from Amazon brand new in factory sealed Sony box.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Such a Deal on a DVD/CD burner
customer_reviews.text: Once in a while a really great deal comes your way. This is one of those deals. First: this is a SONY. Second: it burns practically everything on the market. Third: it comes with Nero software included. Fourth: what a great price. I'm just glad I got one before they were all gone; because deals like this dont fall out of the sky everyday. If you need or want a new or even a second burner, check this out... if there are any left.
customer_reviews.author: mohave jack

customer_reviews.title: really simple, really great
customer_reviews.text: This is a great versatile dvd burner. I have toddler that get into my dvd cases no matter how I hide them. SO many movies wasted. I got burner and it was super easy to install. I had no problem changing the face plate to black and backing up right away. If my comp can handle it any other can.
customer_reviews.author: D. L. Pimentel

customer_reviews.title: Works fine
customer_reviews.text: Creating full 8.5GB dual layer data DVD takes about 30 min. on a 2Ghz P4 w/1GB ram. 4.7GB data DVD takes about 10 min. Good price. Installed 1/23/07. Sony support is good; updated firmware to v. SS23. This replaces a Plextor PX-W4012TA that lasted only 2 years before self-terminating.
customer_reviews.author: J. D. Bryson

customer_reviews.title: dose not deliver as promiss
customer_reviews.text: Will not read all formats as it siad it would. Tried to burn onto Ativa DVD+R DL, ten seconds into the burn it quits even after three to four new disks.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Mcmillian

customer_reviews.title: I wish I were as happy as the other reviewers.
customer_reviews.text: I have a Sony Vaio computer, so when my DVD burner died, I figured I'd get a Sony burner to replace it. It was easy to install, but the face plate doesn't line up exactly with the front panel of my tower, so when I have the front panel on the drive won't open. So I have to leave my tower's front panel off. And I've been only haveing about a 50% success rate when burning DVDs. I don't know if this is because it's a dual-layer burner, but I'm still burning single-layer discs or if it's some flaw in the burner. Either way, I'm making a hell of lot more coasters than I made with my previous burner.
customer_reviews.author: Linquel

customer_reviews.title: Wastes one DVD for every successful one
customer_reviews.text: I don't recommend this burner at all. And why can't I give this a zero star rating? I bought this dvd burner to replace my Lite-on burner that recently quit. In one week I have successfully burned three DVD's from six blanks. Lite-on had a much higher success rate and it was faster than the Sony. I was hoping the Sony would outlast the Lite-on which only lasted about six months. Its been one week and I'm already looking for a replacement for my Sony.
customer_reviews.author: Alisa

customer_reviews.title: No problems so far
customer_reviews.text: I have had the burner installed for about 3 weeks now and have burnt more than 30 dvd/cd's and it has worked well, with only one failure, which burnt ok once I slowed the burn speed down a little. Installation was easy and only took about 10 minutes to do.
customer_reviews.author: droodles

customer_reviews.title: installation dvd not compatible with drive out of the box
customer_reviews.text: The installation cd wouldn't run on the drive right out of the box. Thus, the codecs for dvd playback could not be installed and had to be downloaded from the internet to get it working properly.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin J. Ethier

customer_reviews.title: Fast retail burrner for the money
customer_reviews.text: Have always bought sony DRU burners for my backups has the fastest Xtrnsfer rate as to dump files from media to hard drive. Plus $20 rebate from Sony and $30 from Amazon may my net on this purchase $40 thats as good as it gets.
customer_reviews.author: Cyberwise

customer_reviews.title: Sony DVD Burner
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to install and it works great. I tried to buy one at staples and they told me they didn't have one in stock. They didn't even ask me if I would like them to order me one.
customer_reviews.author: Earl H. Bricker

customer_reviews.title: Nice burner
customer_reviews.text: Its nice. Has both the black and white fronts. I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Chad A. Campbell

product_meta.title: Sony DRU830A 18x Internal Dual-Layer DVD Burner
product_meta.description:
FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The DRU-830A 18x Internal Dual-Layer DVD Burner with DVD-RAM Support from Sony supports 8.5 GB dual layer DVD burning as well as support for standard 4.7 GB DVD media. The drive features a standard EIDE interface, allowing you to install it into almost any computer. 

 The drive allows you to burn DVD+/-R discs at 18x speed, allowing you to write a full DVD in approximately 5 minutes. You can write 8.5 GB dual layer DVD+/-R DL discs at 8x speed and DVD-RAM discs at 12x speed. The drive will also write standard CD-R/RW discs at up to 48x speed. 

 The drive includes the Nero 7 Software Suite for Windows, allowing you to get started burning discs right out of the box. These features and more make the drive an excellent solution for your DVD and CD burning needs. 

 Key Features 

 Fast Burning: The drive writes a full DVD+/-R disc in about 5 minutes, a full DVD+/-RW disc in under 10 minutes, and a full DVD+/-R DL disc in about 15 minutes, saving you time when writing a large number of discs. 

 High Capacity: In order to make backups easier to manage, the drive supports both DVD+R DL and DVD-R DL dual layered media. This dual layered media has a capacity of 8.5 GB per disc, about twice that as a standard DVD disc. 

 Multiple Formats Supported: A full range of DVD and CD formats are supported, which makes it much easier for buying media. These formats include DVD-R, DVD+R, DVD-RW, DVD+RW, DVD-R DL, DVD+R DL, DVD-RAM, CD-R and CD-RW. 

 Extensive Software Bundle: This drive is packaged with the Nero Software Suite 7 for Windows. The suite includes all the software that you need to get the most out of your DVD burner, allowing you to create professional quality DVD discs right out of the box.
feature_bullets: DVD+R double layer and DVD-R dual layer burning
Store up to 8.5 GB of data on one single sided, double layer DVD disc
Improved writing speeds for all DVD formats
Record up to 4 hours of video on double/dual layer discs
Works with 4.7 GB DVD+R/+RW and 8.5 GB double/dual layer discs
